@notice Returns information about the PoolManager
@return A tuple containing:
   _currentPool (the address of the current pool),
   _openDurationInBlocks (the open duration in blocks to use for the next pool),
   _lockDurationInBlocks (the lock duration in blocks to use for the next pool),
   _ticketPrice (the ticket price in DAI for the next pool),
   _feeFractionFixedPoint18 (the fee fraction for the next pool),
   _poolCount (the number of pools that have been created)

nodes.name: setAllowLockAnytime

devdoc.author: Brendan Asselstine

createPool().return: The address of the new pool

getInfo().return: A tuple containing:   _currentPool (the address of the current pool),   _openDurationInBlocks (the open duration in blocks to use for the next pool),   _lockDurationInBlocks (the lock duration in blocks to use for the next pool),   _ticketPrice (the ticket price in DAI for the next pool),   _feeFractionFixedPoint18 (the fee fraction for the next pool),   _poolCount (the number of pools that have been created)

params._allowLockAnytime: Whether the owner can lock and unlock the pools at any time.
params._feeFractionFixedPoint18: The fraction of the gross winnings that should be transferred to the owner as the fee.  Is a fixed point 18 number.
params._lockDurationInBlocks: The duration that a Pool must be locked for.
params._moneyMarket: The Compound Finance MoneyMarket contract to supply and withdraw tokens.
params._openDurationInBlocks: The duration between a Pool's creation and when it can be locked.
params._owner: The owner of the PoolManager.  They are able to change settings and are set as the owner of new lotteries.
params._ticketPrice: The price that tickets should sell for
params._token: The token to use for the Pools

initialize(address).details: The Ownable constructor sets the original `owner` of the contract to the sender account.

isOwner().return: true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.

renounceOwnership().details: Allows the current owner to relinquish control of the contract.

params._allowLockAnytime: True if the Pool can be locked and unlocked anytime, false otherwise.

params._feeFractionFixedPoint18: The fraction to pay out. Must be between 0 and 1 and formatted as a fixed point number with 18 decimals (as in Ether).

params._lockDurationInBlocks: The duration, in blocks, that new pools must be locked for.

params._openDurationInBlocks: The duration, in blocks, that a pool must be open for after it is created.

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

devdoc.title: The Pool Manager contract for PoolTogether.

createPool().notice: Creates a new Pool.  There can be no current pool, or the current pool must be complete. Can only be called by the owner. Fires the PoolCreated event.

init(address,address,address,uint256,uin.notice: Initializes a new PoolManager contract.  Generally called through ZeppelinOS

renounceOwnership().notice: Renouncing to ownership will leave the contract without an owner. It will not be possible to call the functions with the `onlyOwner` modifier anymore.

setAllowLockAnytime(bool).notice: Allows the owner to set whether a Pool can be locked and unlocked at any time. Fires the AllowLockAnytimeChanged event. Can only be set by the owner.  Only applies to subsequent Pools.

setFeeFraction(int256).notice: Sets the fee fraction paid out to the Pool owner. Fires the FeeFractionChanged event. Can only be called by the owner. Only applies to subsequent Pools.

setLockDuration(uint256).notice: Sets the lock duration in blocks for new Pools. Fires the LockDurationChanged event. Can only be set by the owner.  Only applies to subsequent Pools.

setOpenDuration(uint256).notice: Sets the open duration in blocks for new Pools. Fires the OpenDurationChanged event. Can only be set by the owner.  Fires the OpenDurationChanged event.

setTicketPrice(int256).notice: Sets the ticket price in DAI. Fires the TicketPriceChanged event. Can only be called by the owner.  Only applies to subsequent Pools.

userdoc.notice: Creates Pools and ensures that there is only one active Pool at a time.
